page.title: 11HEALTH CARE IN DALRY(KIRK)
page.content: The medical practice consists of a husband and wife team,living in the neighbouring town of New Galloway and operating a daily surgery in Dalry. They make house calls when necessary, provide emergency cover and dispense medicines. They are assisted by two health visitors who help with home nursing care.A chiropodist visits the town every two months. Hospital treatment usually entails a visit to Dumfries and Galloway Royal Infirmary in Dumfries though there are 6 G.P. and 22 geriatric beds in Castle Douglas. Most Dalry babies are born at The Cresswell Maternity Hospital, Dumfries. Local volunteers provide a car service when needed for routine appointments at, and visits to hospitals. An ambulance from Castle Douglas is available in an emergency.
